author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Congress on Monday issued a showcause notice to Virender Singh, the political adviser of senior Congress leader Bhupinder Singh Hooda, who came under fire after an audiotape surfaced on Sunday pointing to his involvement in instigating the unruly mobs in Haryana. “We have issued the notice to him and told him that the accusation is serious and it has caused irreparable damage to the party,” said Ashok Tanwar, Congress leader and party president in Haryana.

In the audio, Prof. Virender Singh purportedly says the “protest was doing well in their area”, while nothing much was happening in the State’s “Deswali belt.”
title: Cong. notice to Hooda’s adviser
